project.description: This job creates a vApp name klinuxw which is needed to support the Scenario demonstrating knife_bootstrap

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# Remove "" from input variables if present VAPP_NAME=`sed -e 's/^"//' -e 's/"$//' <<< $VAPP_NAME` VM_NAME=`sed -e 's/^"//' -e 's/"$//' <<< $VM_NAME`
# Create new VM and Unbuntu Server vca login --password $VCA_PASSWORD --host vchs.vmware.com --type subscription --version 5.6 --org M933009684-4424 vcadevops@gmail.com
vca vdc use --vdc M933009684-4424
export IP=`vca vm -a $VAPP_NAME | grep $VM_NAME | cut -d '|' -f5 | tr -d '[[:space:]]'` && echo $IP
# if vapp exists skip if [ ${#IP} -lt 1 ] then
vca vapp create -a $VAPP_NAME -V $VM_NAME -c 'Public Catalog' -t 'Ubuntu Server 12.04 LTS (amd64 20150127)' -n M933009684-4424-default-routed -m DHCP
vca vapp customize --vapp $VAPP_NAME --vm $VM_NAME --file ~/add_public_ssh_key.sh
# get the new vm ip and add it to /etc/hosts for a in 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9; do export IP=`vca vm -a $VAPP_NAME | grep $VM_NAME | cut -d '|' -f5 | tr -d '[[:space:]]'`
echo "Obtain IP attempt $a" if [ ${#IP} -gt 1 ] then echo "New VM at $IP" break else sleep 10 fi done
if [ ${#IP} -gt 1 ] then echo "${IP} ${VM_NAME}" | sudo tee --append /etc/hosts fi fi
